enable_trace_context.description: Enable trace context. If `true` a `Traceparent` header will be added to the request. Default: `false`

environment.description:
The API environment that the provider interacts with. Options are `dev`, `qa`, `prod`.
This attribute can also be loaded from `STACKIT_ENV` environment variable instead.

private_key.description:
Private RSA Key.
This attribute can also be loaded from `STACKIT_PRIVATE_KEY` environment variable instead.

private_key_path.description:
Path to the Private RSA Key.
This attribute can also be loaded from `STACKIT_PRIVATE_KEY_PATH` environment variable instead.

service_account_email.description:
Service Account Email.
This attribute can also be loaded from `STACKIT_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL` environment variable instead.

service_account_key.description:
Service Account Key.
This attribute can also be loaded from `STACKIT_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_KEY` environment variable instead.

service_account_key_path.description:
Path to the Service Account Key.
This attribute can also be loaded from `STACKIT_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_KEY_PATH` environment variable instead.

service_account_token.description:
Service Account Token.
This attribute can also be loaded from `STACKIT_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_TOKEN` environment variable instead.

block.description:
The STACKIT provider is a project developed and maintained by the STACKIT community within Schwarz IT. Please note that it is not an official provider endorsed or maintained by STACKIT.

~> **Note:** The provider is built using Terraform's plugin framework, therefore we recommend using Terraform CLI v1.x which supports Protocol v6

## Authentication

Before you can start using the client, you will need to create a STACKIT Service Account in your project and assign it the appropriate permissions (i.e. `project.owner`).
After the service account has been created, you can authenticate to the client using the `Key flow`  (recommended) or with the static `Token flow` (less secure as the token is long-lived).

### Key flow

1. Follow instructions in the [community client](https://github.com/SchwarzIT/community-stackit-go-client#key-flow)

2. You can configure the Key flow by providing paths using environment variables or by configuring the paths in the provider block (`Key flow (1)` example below)

   ```bash
   export STACKIT_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_KEY_PATH="sa_key.json"
   export STACKIT_PRIVATE_KEY_PATH="private_key.pem"
   ```

3. Another way is to provide the contents directly, either with environment variables or by configuring the provider directly (`Key flow (2)` example below)

   ```bash
   export STACKIT_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_KEY_="..."
   export STACKIT_PRIVATE_KEY="..."
   ```

### Token flow

1. Set the following environment variables or configure the provider directly (example below)

   ```bash
   export STACKIT_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL=email
   export STACKIT_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_TOKEN=token
   ```

instance_id.description: Instance ID the credential belongs to

project_id.description: Project ID the credential belongs to

block.description:
Manages Argus instance credentials
-> __Environment support__
Productionhttps://argus.api.stackit.cloud
QAhttps://argus.api.stg.stackit.cloud
Devhttps://argus.api.dev.stackit.cloud

By default, production is used.
To set a custom URL, set an environment variable STACKIT_ARGUS_BASEURL

enable_public_access.description: If true, anyone can access Grafana dashboards without logging in. Default is set to `false`.

grafana_initial_admin_password.description: Specifies an initial Grafana admin password.

grafana_initial_admin_user.description: Specifies an initial Grafana admin username.

is_updatable.description: Specifies if the instance can be updated.

retention_days.description: Specifies for how many days the raw metrics are kept. Default is set to `90`

retention_days_1h_downsampling.description: Specifies for how many days the 1h downsampled metrics are kept. must be less than the value of the 5m downsampling retention. Default is set to `0` (disabled).

retention_days_5m_downsampling.description: Specifies for how many days the 5m downsampled metrics are kept. must be less than the value of the general retention. Default is set to `0` (disabled).

name.description: Specifies the name of the Argus instance

plan.description: Specifies the Argus plan. Available options are: `Monitoring-Medium-EU01`, `Monitoring-Large-EU01`, `Frontend-Starter-EU01`, `Monitoring-XL-EU01`, `Monitoring-XXL-EU01`, `Monitoring-Starter-EU01`, `Monitoring-Basic-EU01`, `Observability-Medium-EU01`, `Observability-Large-EU01 `, `Observability-XL-EU01`, `Observability-Starter-EU01`, `Observability-Basic-EU01`, `Observability-XXL-EU01`.

project_id.description: Specifies the Project ID the Argus instance belongs to

metrics_path.description: Specifies the job scraping path. Defaults to `/metrics`

name.description: Specifies the name of the scraping job

project_id.description: Specifies the Project ID the Argus instance belongs to

enable_url_parameters.description: Should URL parameters be enabled? Default is `true`

scrape_interval.description: Specifies the scrape interval as duration string. Default is `5m`.

scrape_timeout.description: Specifies the scrape timeout as duration string. Default is `2m`.

block.description:
Manages ElasticSearch instances
-> __Environment support__
Productionhttps://elasticsearch.api.eu01.stackit.cloud
QAhttps://elasticsearch.api.eu01.qa.stackit.cloud
Devhttps://elasticsearch.api.eu01.dev.stackit.cloud

By default, production is used.
To set a custom URL, set an environment variable STACKIT_ELASTICSEARCH_BASEURL

allow_privileged_containers.description: Should containers be allowed to run in privileged mode? Default is `true`

allowed_cidrs.description: Specify a list of CIDRs to whitelist

acl.description: Cluster access control configuration

argus_instance_id.description: Instance ID of argus, Required when enabled is set to `true`

enabled.description: Flag to enable/disable argus extensions. Defaults to `false`

argus.description: A single argus block as defined below

extensions.description: A single extensions block as defined below

end.description: End time of hibernation, in crontab syntax, i.e. `0 8 * * *` for waking up the cluster at 8am

start.description: Start time of cluster hibernation, in crontab syntax, i.e. `0 18 * * *` for starting everyday at 6pm

timezone.description: Timezone name corresponding to a file in the IANA Time Zone database. i.e. `Europe/Berlin`

hibernations.description: One or more hibernation block as defined below

kube_config.description: Kube config file used for connecting to the cluster

kubernetes_version.description: Kubernetes version. Allowed Options are: `1.22`, `1.23`, `1.24`, or a full version including patch (not recommended).

kubernetes_version_used.description: Full Kubernetes version used. For example, if `1.22` was selected, this value may result to `1.22.15`

enable_kubernetes_version_updates.description: Flag to enable/disable auto-updates of the Kubernetes version

enable_machine_image_version_updates.description: Flag to enable/disable auto-updates of the OS image version

end.description: RFC3339 Date time for maintenance window end. i.e. `2019-08-24T23:30:00Z`

start.description: RFC3339 Date time for maintenance window start. i.e. `2019-08-24T23:00:00Z`

maintenance.description: A single maintenance block as defined below

name.description: Specifies the cluster name (lower case, alphanumeric, hypens allowed, up to 11 chars)

container_runtime.description: Specifies the container runtime. Defaults to `containerd`. Allowed options are `docker`, `containerd`

labels.description: Labels to add to each node

max_surge.description: The maximum number of nodes upgraded simultaneously. Defaults to 1. (Value must be between 1-10)

max_unavailable.description: The maximum number of nodes unavailable during upgraded. Defaults to 1

maximum.description: Maximum nodes in the pool. Defaults to 2. (Value must be between 1-100)

minimum.description: Minimum nodes in the pool. Defaults to 1. (Value must be between 1-100)

name.description: Specifies the name of the node pool

os_name.description: The name of the OS image. Only `flatcar` is supported

effect.description: The taint effect. Only `PreferNoSchedule` is supported at the moment

key.description: Taint key to be applied to a node

value.description: Taint value corresponding to the taint key

taints.description: Specifies a taint list as defined below

volume_size_gb.description: The volume size in GB. Default is set to `20`

volume_type.description: Specifies the volume type. Defaults to `storage_premium_perf1`. Available options are `storage_premium_perf0`, `storage_premium_perf1`, `storage_premium_perf2`, `storage_premium_perf4`, `storage_premium_perf6`

zones.description: Specify a list of availability zones. Accepted options are `eu01-m` for metro, or `eu01-1`, `eu01-2`, `eu01-3`

node_pools.description: One or more `node_pool` block as defined below

Available options: `1.1` (1 CPU, 1 Memory), `1.2` (1 CPU, 2 Memory), `1.4` (1 CPU, 4 Memory), `1.8` (1 CPU, 8 Memory), `2.4` (2 CPU, 4 Memory), `2.8` (2 CPU, 8 Memory), `2.16` (2 CPU, 16 Memory), `4.8` (4 CPU, 8 Memory), `4.16` (4 CPU, 16 Memory), `4.32` (4 CPU, 32 Memory), `8.16` (8 CPU, 16 Memory), `8.32` (8 CPU, 32 Memory), `8.64` (8 CPU, 64 Memory), `16.32` (16 CPU, 32 Memory), `16.64` (16 CPU, 64 Memory)

kube_config.description: Kube config file used for connecting to the cluster

kubernetes_version_used.description: Full Kubernetes version used. For example, if `1.22` was selected, this value may result to `1.22.15`

enable_kubernetes_version_updates.description: Flag to enable/disable auto-updates of the Kubernetes version

enable_machine_image_version_updates.description: Flag to enable/disable auto-updates of the OS image version

end.description: RFC3339 Date time for maintenance window end. i.e. `2019-08-24T23:30:00Z`

start.description: RFC3339 Date time for maintenance window start. i.e. `2019-08-24T23:00:00Z`

maintenance.description: A single maintenance block as defined below

name.description: Specifies the cluster name (lower case, alphanumeric, hypens allowed, up to 11 chars)

labels.description: Labels to add to each node

max_surge.description: The maximum number of nodes upgraded simultaneously.

max_unavailable.description: The maximum number of nodes unavailable during upgraded.

name.description: Specifies the name of the node pool

os_name.description: The name of the OS image.

effect.description: The taint effect. Only `PreferNoSchedule` is supported at the moment

key.description: Taint key to be applied to a node

value.description: Taint value corresponding to the taint key

taints.description: Specifies a taint list as defined below

zones.description: Specify a list of availability zones.

node_pools.description: One or more `node_pool` block as defined below

project_id.description: this attribure is deprecated. please remove it from your terraform config and use `kubernetes_project_id` instead

block.description:
Data source for STACKIT Kubernetes Engine (SKE) clusters
-> __Environment support__
Productionhttps://ske.api.eu01.stackit.cloud/
QAhttps://ske.api.eu01.stg.stackit.cloud/
Devhttps://ske.api.eu01.dev.stackit.cloud/

By default, production is used.
To set a custom URL, set an environment variable STACKIT_KUBERNETES_BASEURL

project_id.description: the project ID that SKE will be enabled in

block.description:
Data source for STACKIT Kubernetes Engine (SKE) project

Devhttps://ske.api.eu01.dev.stackit.cloud/

By default, production is used.
To set a custom URL, set an environment variable STACKIT_KUBERNETES_BASEURL

project_id.description: Project ID the credential belongs to
